devanagari:
अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-
अनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् ।
पश्यामि त्वां दीप्‍तहुताशवक्त्रं
स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥ १९ ॥
transliteration:
anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryam
ananta-bāhuṁ śaśi-sūrya-netram
paśyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśa-vaktraṁ
sva-tejasā viśvam idaṁ tapantam

synonyms.meaning: having a mouth blazing like fire

translation: You are the origin without beginning, middle or end. You have numberless arms, and the sun and moon are among Your unlimited eyes. By Your own radiance, You are heating this entire universe.
purport: There is no limit to the extent of the six opulences of the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Here and in many other places there is repetition, but according to the scriptures, repetition of the glories of Kṛṣṇa is not a literary weakness. It is said that at a time of bewilderment, wonder, or great ecstasy, statements are repeated over and over. That is not a flaw.
